net.sourceforge.waters.analysis.comp552

Class ModelChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.waters.analysis.comp552.ModelChecker
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConflictChecker, ControllabilityChecker

    public abstract class ModelChecker
extends Object

    An abstract class defining the interface of a model checker.

    A model checker takes a finite-state machine model as input and performs a particular kind of analysis on it. When done, it returns the result, i.e., whether the particular property checked is true or false. Furthermore, if the property is found not to be satisfied, the model checker provides a counterexample in the form of a sequence of events, explaining why the property that was checked is not satisfied.

    To use a model checker, the user first creates an instance of a subclass of this class, and sets up the model to be checked as well as any other parameters that may be needed. Then model checking is started using the run() method. Then, if the property was found not to be satisfied a counterexample can be retrieved using the getCounterExample() method. This all can be done with the following code.

    ProductDESProxyFactory factory = ProductDESElementFactory.getInstance();
    ModelChecker checker = new ControllabilityChecker(des, factory); // e.g.
    boolean result = checker.run();
    if (result) {
      // property satisfied ...
    } else {
      // property not satisfied ...
      TraceProxy counterexample = checker.getCounterExample();
    }

    This class is to be subclassed to implement model checking algorithms for various properties. Each subclass must implement at least the methods run() and getCounterExample().

    Author:
    Robi Malik

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModelChecker

        public ModelChecker(ProductDESProxy model,
                    ProductDESProxyFactory factory)
        Creates a new model checker to check a particular model.
        Parameters:
        model - The model to be checked by this model checker.
        factory - Factory used for trace construction.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public abstract boolean run()
        Runs this model checker. This method starts the model checking process on the model given as parameter to the constructor of this object. On termination, if the result is false, a counterexample can be queried using getCounterExample() method.
        Returns:
        true or false to indicate whether the property checked is satisfied or not.

      • getModel

        public ProductDESProxy getModel()
        Gets the model under investigation by this model checker.
        Returns:
        The model checked by this model checker, as passed into its constructor ModelChecker().

      • getFactory

        public ProductDESProxyFactory getFactory()
        Gets the factory used for trace construction.

      • getCounterExample

        public abstract CounterExampleProxy getCounterExample()
        Gets a counterexample if model checking has found that the property checked is not satisfied.
        Returns:
        A trace object constructed for the model that was checked. It shares events and automata with the input model.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called before model checking has completed, i.e., before run() has been called, or model checking has found that the property is satisfied and there is no counterexample.
